datafield.subfield: Curationes particularium affectum Interprete Vinsentio Garsia Salat seu potius Ludouico Collada :
Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use.
Medical vademecum of eighteen short treatises, principally concerning neurological and cardiovascular complaints.

Binding (Spain? 16th c?): Limp animal skin parchment. Straight caps, bookblock rounded, natural hollow, cut edges, fore edge cover extensions, no decoration or title. Remnants of alum-tawed thong fastenings at fore edge. Compound endbands: off-white primary, rose/yellow secondary with front bead, over parchment core, endband slips laced through outer joints. Sewn on three alum-tawed thongs laced through outer joints. Endleaf components: front inserted sewn fold off-white handmade laid paper making free endleaf, stub (first leaf of first gathering missing); back final six (of eight leaves) of final gathering text blanks.

MS 3327, Container 64: Para Dr. Brooks en recuerdo de su visita a Barcelona, signed Francisco [Wurtz?]; other notes Aug 6/89, 4941/1, #268 Salat; acquired by the Ransom Center (R5374) in 1973 from Jenkins and Company. Binding (Spain? 16th c?): Limp animal skin parchment. Straight caps, bookblock rounded, natural hollow, cut edges, fore edge cover extensions, no decoration or title. Remnants of alum-tawed thong fastenings at fore edge. Compound endbands: off-white primary, rose/yellow secondary with front bead, over parchment core, endband slips laced through outer joints. Sewn on three alum-tawed thongs laced through outer joints. Endleaf components: front inserted sewn fold off-white handmade laid paper making free endleaf, stub (first leaf of first gathering missing); back final six (of eight leaves) of final gathering text blanks.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
